text: Tap, sample. Tasted on the 20/06/2017 at Bandullo (Compostela). Clear golden with a big white head. Aroma of grains, yeast, bread and flowers. Taste of grains, yeast and a slightly floral hoppy finish. Next one please!

Tomada en Nochevieja 2016 en el Kraken.
Sin filtrar ni pasteurizar.
Bastante dulce. Refrescante y facil de beber.

Rubia con espuma blanca.

0,5 l on tap at Godec pub. Pours clear yellow with big thick white lasting head that leaves some nice lacing. Aroma of malt, bread with pilsner pollen touch and herbal noble hop aroma. Slightly grainy. Taste is light bitter sweet. Body is refreshing, but not watery. Texture is slick with average carbonation, finish is light bitter. For 4% ABV its surprisingly rich. Almost perfectly balanced and drinkable. Top pilsner by any rate.

Many bottles from Pezinská pivná pumpa. 
This is my absolute favorite lawnmower beer. And not only because of 1.5l package. It has excellent appearance with big white head. Ideal carbonation and perfectly balanced taste. One of the best, if not the best, Czech pilsner.

On tap at Hopaholic, Budapest. Pours golden yellow colour. Moderate white head. Malty, slightly grassy aroma. Malty, refreshing taste. Really light sweetness. Nice, slughtly bitter aftertaste. Amazing body for such a low alcochol beer. Really well balanced brew. Nothing to add, nothing to take away. Traditional pilsner. However bit plain, but it is a very drinkable beer.
da best of da best, nejlepsi lezak co znam, muzu pit porad, az na veky veku

Kran. W aromacie poza klasycznymi nutami słodowymi i kwiatowymi nieprzyjemna siarkowo - jajeczna nuta. W wyglądzie bursztynowe, klarowne, z ładną pianą. W smaku słodowo, ziołowo, chlebowo, spora goryczka, smaczne i całkiem bogate. Pijalność spora. Ogólnie bardzo dobry czeski pils, główny minus to średnio przyjemny zapach.

On [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ pub Lj: pours slightly clear/hazy with foamy lasting white head. Aroma: gentle dms, corn, spicy, earhty, herbal hop profile. Flavoir just follows aroma: bready malt backbone, supported with gentle diacetyl, hop notes, mentioned above. Light to moderate body, medium hop bitterness, crisp like texture, moderate carbonation.
25-03-17 // draught at Koutská piváreň in Bratislava. pours an almost clear golden beer with a big foamy head. Pilsner nose typical. Aroma is slight grainy, malty, medium sweet. Light bitter finish.
On tap, @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo 06/04/2017 Color amarillo claro, aromas a cereal algo floral, sabor inicial maltoso seguido de notas herbales, cuerpo sedoso agradable.

On tap in Godec Pub, Ljubljana. Pours with a lot of white top, which doesnt stay with you for too long. Aroma is sweet-sour. A combination of a sweet honey, malt aroma mixed with yeast and thus a slight sour hint. Body is light with a gentle carbonation, medium bitterness, fresh, yet not hoppy aftertaste. A very fine Pilsener

On tap at Hopaholic Budapest. Aroma is a bit weak, bready. Pale, clear, few bubbles, sustained head. Immediate prickly bitterness, followed by classic doughy pilzen taste. Nice long tasty finish. Probably the best Czech pils Ive ever had.
De barril en El Cervecero. Dorada de preciosa espuma algodonada. Aroma rico a cereal. Paso muy fácil, ricamente malteada con notas cítricas y un punto perfecto de amargor. Gran Pilsen
Pan, cereal y ligero sulfuro en aroma. En boca se añade un toque cítrico y un final seco. Excelente.

Keg @Kraken, Oviedo. 02-01-2017.
In short: yeasty sweet pilsner.
Pours hazy bright gold with nice white head. Moderate head retetnion, little lacing. Yeasty, malty, sweet nose. Light body, average carbonation, little crispy texture. Taste is quite sweet, grainy sweet, yeasty, a bit sulphury.
UPDATED: JAN 5, 2017 Caña en Cervecería Kraken (Oviedo) Color amarillo, algo turbia al no estar filtrada, con buen sabor para ser tan suave

Caña en el kraken 02..01..2017 (r126). Color amarillento la hizo algo turbio aromas y sabores maltosos y cereales con buen dulzor y un ligero herbaceos algo amargo al final. Cuerpo ligero con 4 vol y un gran sabor. Bastante buena y refrescante. Para repetir.

Bottle. Rather pale yellow, medium white head, champagne-like soft carbonation. Aroma malt, apricots. Light body. Taste bitter-sweet, apricots again. Palate feel again evokes champagne - subtle bubbles. Probably the best desitka I have tasted to date.
Botella de plástico en la propia fábrica. La pureza de estilo en un entorno insuperable. La selva de bohemia. Sin filtrar ni pasteurizar pero mucho más limpia que urquell.

F: big, white, good retention.
C: gold, clear.
A: malt, hint of fruity, yeast, bread, caramel, floral hops.
T: malt, bread, caramel, yeast, toast, medium body, good carbonation, very good balanced beer, on tap @ La Putika cafe, Mytna, Bratislava.

Tap at Targowa, Wroclaw - as Kout Pils - clear golden color with creamy head. Fine body for a 4% Abv. Taste is sweet malts, much toffee, saazer hops, medium bitter finish. Good example for the style, but I just cant stand it.
Tap on Salon Piva. Clear yellow color with white head. Aroma of toffee and sulphur. Flavor of malt and caramel. Ballace towards bitterness which lingers long in aftertaste. Medium body, average carb.
Tap @Targowa, Wroclaw, Poland. Sparse, white, creamy head, golden colour, clear. Aroma of malts with a bit of berries. Bitter taste, light body, long finish, lively. Nice and refreshing pils.

Aroma: grass, butter, some herbal notes
Taste: light bitter, graas, corn, some honey notes

A great brewing accomplishment at 4% abv! Best beer at a recent trip to the ChurchKey. A minimal white head over a gold body. The nose is substantial for a lighter pilsner, featuring biscuit malt, a touch of booze and ripe tropical fruit. The taste profile leads with rich and slightly roasty dark pils malt, with some mango and citrus. Complex and very tasteful low alcohol pilsner
Capovane v Kine Usmev.Svetlo zlte,cire pivo,sladova a horka chut dobre zbalancovana pre 10tku.Osviezujuce pivo vhodne na uhasenie smadu v letnych dnoch.

Numerous pours over the past five years: Hazy golden. Thin cap of creamy white foam. Rustic and complexly malty nose of butter cookie, piecrust, cracker dough, along with a plentitude of hop-derived fennel candy, pepper and lemon oil. Perfect touch of yogurty yeast and minerals. Soft body is draped in creamy carbonation. Vividly defined peppery hops inundate the palate alongside richly textured malt which unleashes a host toasty and cookielike notes. Bracing minerals mirror the profoundly refined grassy bitterness which exerts itself forcefully. Dabs of lemon candy drip from the nectar-filled hops. Malt continually looms with lush and bouncy toasted hay and a well-measured sweetness that evokes candied pecans, toffee and some discernible kettle caramelization. Potently brisk finish is liberally dosed with palate-cleansing minerals and a spicy hop punch of candied fennel. An evocative, soulful, old-fashioned světlé leák embodying the rustic charm you might expect from such masterfully decocted malt centered around open fermentation and the brewerys divine well water. The quintessence of Czech brewing.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: On tap @ Na 7. schode, ilina. Aroma of malts, herbs, lightly hops. Golden colour, clear liquid, good white head. Taste is of bread, malts, hops, herbs. light sweetness, medium bitterness. Medium to full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, easy bitter finish. Very excelent beer. This is my favourite lager.
PET bottle. Aroma is mostly malty, with some herbal hops. Medium bitterness. Medium body, does not feel watery. Very decent.

On tap at Craft Bar 30A in Grayton Beach, FL. For someone who doesnt typically drink this style I was impressed. Seemed a bit more complex than most pilsner beer Ive tried. Aroma and taste similar. Grainy, cereal notes. Bread. A floral hop character that was excellent. Super balanced. Mouth feel was light and refreshing. Super nice expression of this style.
Tap at churchkey. So good. Bright fruit and earth. Taste light sweet light bitter. Lightish body with lively carbonation.

Draught. Pours clean golden with fluffy head - very nice. Aroma of malt and old butter. In taste better, pils malt with medium strenght bitterness, butter also present but on minimal level. All except the butter is ok, still dont get why they love their beers with butter.
Kran. Bardzo przyzwoity czeski pils. Ładnie ułożony, pijalny. Nic się zbytnio nie wyróżnia, ani też nie przeszkadza. Dobre piwo na posiedzenie ze znajomymi.

0,5l from tap at pivni opice brno as ?Koutska Desitka 10?. Yellow clear shiny colour, small white head. Smells of tobacco, grass. Medium body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. Tastes of bread, grains, light grains, light sweetness, bit milky. Finishes lightly bitter with notes of grains and grass. Decent one
Tap at halmicaffe. Clear golden colour with white head. Aroma of malt,hops. Taste of bread,malts,bitter finish. Good balanced beer. Drinkable

fra fad
duft behalllig malt duft med kan af lidt krydret humle
smag. blid mag ingen off smag. dejligt med en god pilsner

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, light banana, buttery and moderate hoppy - grass. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish. The butter may be intentional, but I still dont like it. The keg was put on yesterday, so I consider that fresh. 131215
Tap @ Fermentoren, AArhus, 4%. clear golden with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hop, grainy, grass ans saaz. Flavour is malt, fruit, hop, grass, grainy, meidum sweet, saaz an dmedium bitter.
Super delicate malt softness and grainy body. Fantastic color, foam retention. Saaz hops all the way through. Hard to believe such a full-tasting beer is only 10 degrees plato.

On tap @Mad For Beer (Rome). Pours a vivid golden color with a medium white foam. Aroma is malty, biscuits, herbs, spices, so fresh, delicate and pleasant, wow! Flavour is malty, light sweet and mild bitter, very fresh, drinkable but satisfy. Low body, light carbonation. Im so impressed on the quality and freshness of this beer!
To tap pub Rebel in Prievidza,cloudy golden yellow color,fluffy white head ,aroma of peppery white bread,taste is clean and crisp.

Light strawy color. Stable white head an inch thick. Palate thick and silky smooth. Espeially for such a low plato. Heavy malts aroma. Taste is malt forward, with balanced neutral biterness with milky-like palate. Enjoyed. One of the finest lagers and 10-platoish beers altogether for me.

Part of a 10 euro, 6 beer blind tasting set at Trois 8s biergarten event in Paris. A slightly opaque gold with a thick head of foam. A malty sweet aroma with biting noble hops. Nice, crisp and fresh.
Draft at Mad For Beer, Rome. Bright, pretty good, tall, dissipating white foam. Soft bready yeast, golden and sharp. Good tart yeast, fresh bread. A little banana. Nice shape. Tasty.
Ottima pils, bevuta alla spina. Schiuma bianca persistente, profumi di malti equilibrati dai luppoli, finale lungo, amaro e secco. Splendida!

On tap. Nuspirit. Clear golden colour with nice white stable head. Aroma yeast, hops some malty sweetness. Taste: some sweetness from malts, maybe it could has been less sweet. Bitter. A bit taste of candies. Quite full body. Bitter aftertaste with malty taste notes. Very good pilsner.
On tap @ 8. Czeh Beerfestival Budapest. Nice classic czeh beer color. Great head. Aroma is so nice, tasty some citrus, caramell, great pne.

On tap @Triangle Paris. A copper beer with low head. Nose is on sweet cereals, touch of grain. Aroma is on grain and cereals, very crisp, a clear bitterness on grass and almond, marzipan, nice average bitterness especially on aftertaste, good grain and sweet malt. Nice saaz notes, kellerbier touch.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2015 Polliter v Lokal Pube v Nitre. Zlatá farba, biela jemná pena, krúkuje, aróma chmelovo sladová. Chuť príjemne horkastá, na desinu plná, skvelé pivo!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap. This is the best low-alcohol pilsener I have ever had. Beautiful hops aroma, light clear pilsener color, white head. I could drink this instead of water forever.
Draft at Churchkey, thanks to solidfunk. Thanks! Poured a light copper color, clear with a small off-white head. Aroma was light crisp malt,s grassy notes. Light sweetness. Pretty tasty.
Very nice, very drinkable. Blonde pour with decent head. Sharp Czech hops aroma, slight touch of mint and wood. Light bitter grainy finish. Tap at Churchkey.
Draft at Edmunds. Jesus, this beer is so goddamn good, would drink by the gallons.
A beer with light color, good aroma, foam and medium bitter, soft carbonized, served from tap.
on tap oro limpida buona schiuma discreta nota maltate cereale erbaceo lieve terroso piccolo diacetile amaro medio leggera mela
Alla spina. Aroma mielato, cereale ed erbaceo. al palato pulita, fresca e beverina con un erbaceo finale quasi pepato che invoglia al sorso successivo.
Draught @ albion. Clear rich yellow with small foamy white head, doughy aroma, low cabonation, sweetish yeasty taste, abrupt finish. Not the best or even a decent pilsener I have tasted.

On tap at "na 7.schode", Zilina. Golden pale yellow color, almost straw like, white head, leaves lacing. Aroma of malts, grassy, butter, straw, herbs, some spring flowers, very pleasant and inviting. Taste is even better, bread, malts, grassy, herbs, moderate bittery, moderate sweetnes, medium body, creamy texutre and soft carbonation. This is definitely the best 10° beer I have had until now, awesomely ballanced.

On tap at Mad for Beer pub in Rome-Italy, with mortlach. Pours a great dark-golden color, semi-filtered with a compact white cap. Nose is definitely malty with some floral notes. The mouth is lovely and exactly what you expect from a Czech pilsner: floral, malty and with some juicy feel of biscuits. The bitter end is gentle and drinking this beer easy. Loved it.

On tap at Perdition. It pours a semi clear light golden color with a nice white head. The aroma is soft honeyed pilsner malt with hints of melon and peach with floral, herbal hops. The flavor is similarly soft with mild sulfer, strong herbal hops, hints of lemongrass and melon. Light hop spice in the finish with more honeyed malt. Really nice. A top velvety soft, malty, herbal floral hopped Czech Pils.

From tap at Kabaret Spacek i Brno with HDI 13.12.14. Clear pale golden. White head and lacing. Slightly fruity aroma, with Czech hops, succade pears/yellow apples. Similar taste. Moderate bitterness. Very quaffable.

6th Oct 2014, 0.3 litre on tap in the BeerGeek Bar, Prague. Clear and bright golden pour with a white head. Fairly sweet malty nose and taste, drying later in the mouth. Good example of the style but nothing to set it apart from hundreds like it.

The Sampler, Brooklyn tap: I assume that this is what I had. It was labelled as Koutska 10... In any case, it poured golden with a white head. Aroma was grass and bread. Taste was a subtle, lightly hopped, not very sweet bready and grassy taste. This beer doesnt fall into the typical pitfalls of Bohemian pilseners of being overly grainy or overly sweet. This beer is a lesson in balance and restraint.

Dry on the palate intially. Malt sweetness is the main flavor along with a pronounced bitterness. The malt flavor and swertness is not overbearing. Crisp and clean tasting, body is medium and a slight honey like flavor lingers in the finish. Clear dark gold color. This is an excellent brew to drink on a hot day like today. The dryness is n o t cloying and it seems like I could continue drinkin these all day.

On tap at Holy Grale. Aroma: A moderate dose of noble hops hit you at first, but theres just a little grainy semi-sweetness underneath. Appearance: Slightly hazy coppery gold pour with a frothy white head that sustains throughout. Flavor: Malts come up to balance the rich noble hop character; the malts sustain almost throughout the beer with their pleasant, semi sweet presence, striking a perfect bittersweet balance until the very finish. A lingering noble hop release finally dries things up. Amazing to me how these Czech pilsners get so much malt character out of a 4% beer. Palate: Medium body, very creamy texture, very soft carbonation, lingering finish. Overall: Maybe Im too high on this, but this was perfect, from expectation to realization. The folks in the Czech Republic are awfully lucky to have beers like this, and brewers with the skill to make them.
Delicate hoppy aroma. Head disappearing to durable layer. Clear light golden body. Noticeable bitterness with a bit of butter. No-brainer.

Tap. Clear golden yellow, nice white lacing. Hay and light citrus notes in the aroma with some dough sourness. Flavor is much more interesting with dough, citrus, earthy hop zip. Lighter body with good carbonation.
Tap. Clear golden color. Medium size, white head, stays. Malty, sourish, grainy, faint hops in aroma. Sweet malts, faint grassyness in taste. Crisp and gassy mouthfeel. Mild bitterness in aftertaste.

Tap (Drink Baar, Tallinn)
Nice citrussy czech/slovakian hoppy aroma, crisp and sharp. Light palate, decent carbonation. Light malts, fairly pleasant taste, some herbal to grassy hops. Palate a bit crisp with the carbonation high and the body a bit thin. Love the light malts, nice light barley fills the mouth and lasts for ever. barley barley barley - great!
Clear pale body with medium head. Aroma is malty, noble. Taste is sweet malty with earthy noble bitterness, balanced. Palate well balanced. Body is full, high carbonation.

On tap at Grand Öl & Mat. I always enjoy when something from the old-world pops-up that i havent tried before. Unfortunately for this beer, despite its long trek, it failed to make an impression with me.

On tap @ Le Supercoin (Paris). Clear golden/blond with a small white head and some lacing. Aroma is of saaz, breadied malt, fresh cereals, light sweetness and some herbal notes. Taste is also of breadied malt, light sweetness, saaz, fresh cereals and some herbal notes. Very light bitterness. Light body. Good carbonation. Crisp and clean. Amazing drinkability while being quite tasty. Thirst quenching and refreshing.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2014 15.10.2014: (7/3/8/3/14) Tapped at La Putika 5 -Záhradnícka in Bratislava. Pours clear light golden liquid, small white foamy head, Aroma: nice malty, yeasty and light fruity, Taste: light to medium sweet, medium bitter, light sour, hopy, Palate: medium body, average carbonation, sticky mouthfeel, abrupt malty finish, Overall: good hopy light pilsner.
19.01.2014: (7/3/7/3/14)Tapped at KC Dunaj in Bratislava. App: Pours clear yellow liquid, low white head with medium bubbles. Aroma: malt, hoppy. Taste: medium body, average carbonation, medium bitterness. OV: Good lager.
Tap. Golden color with medium white head. Malty aroma with metallic notes. Malty taste with light hoppy bitterness in finish.
On tap. Pours pale golden color with white head. Aroma is strongly malty, floral hops. Taste is same as aroma, medium bitter. Long bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2017 (tap 0,5l @ Kocour (Brno)) (9.8.2013)
Musty, light hops aroma. Clear golden color. All time white head. Light sweet, light bitter, light hoppy flavour. Medium body. Bitter finish. Good 10°. (6.5.6.4..14=3.5)
(tap 0,5l @ Nekonečno (Brno)) (16.3.2017)
Aroma: Yeasts, sweet, malty.
Appearance: Clear golden color. All time, creamy white head.
Taste: Yeasts, medium sweet, light bitter.
Palate: Medium body. Long bitter finish.
Overall: Good. (6.5.7.4..14=3.6)
Draft at Churchkey. Cloudy golden yellow color, fluffy white head. Aroma of peppery white bread. Taste is clean and crisp. Good stuff.

Draft at Churchkey. Cloudy, unfiltered golden pour with solid frothy white head. Nose and flavor hold gorgeous spicy Saaz notes, along with floral character, bits of bready malt, and light earthy bite as well. Gorgeous, crisp palate but still full flavored. Tremendous pils.

Tap ; Pilsen ;CZ ; Malt,bread,grass,buttery and floral aroma ; Clear golden color with bigger lasting head ; Medium sweet taste with nice bitter finish ; Refreshing ; Lighter body ; Superb Czech Pilsner.
Grain on the nose with a clear pour. Thin head. Some corn. Good medium mouth. Taste is full of grain. Slight bitterness.

Tap at La Putika. Aroma rather malty, typical pilsnery. Clear golden colour, stable white head. Taste is very nicely balanced malty and hoppy, with light yeastiness. Very fine 10º. Smooth mouthfeel, easily drinkable.

Tap at The Festival. Pours clear gold with a medium, fizzy white head, short retention with light lacing. Aroma is spicy hops and Pils malt. Flavor is Pils malt, medium hops and bitterness and a clean lager character with a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

So glad to see these guys at The Festival. I think I spent over half my tickets here. From the tap (screw the pitcher pour!) Clear pale gold pour with thick frothy, creamy white head. Great hoppy saaz nose, very light cereal, great saaz flavor, quite bitter with crisp bready malt.
UPDATED: JUN 20, 2013 Draft. Farmhousey type feel. Perfect appearance. Super hoppy, no diacetyl. Huge mineral. A truly exponential czech pilsener.
Really good light lager. Suprisingly thick head and bitterness. Some light fruity tones from a start. Beer that "drinks itself" :)
On Tap,very light and drinkable with a crisp hoppy flavor and a grassy,yeasty,sweet malt aroma..Good for a light beer but not my favorite Czech 10 lager.
Keg. Pours Clear Gold with a thick White head. Aroma is of fresh cut grass. Flavour is grainy and slightly creamy leading to a wonderfully dry finish. Very good for a 4% job. Crisp and refreshing.

Tap at Churchkey as "Koutska 10° (Unfiltered/ Unpasteurized Helles Lager)". Pours a low haze, glowing gold. Sheety white lacing. Rocky retention. No heavy yeast in suspension haze/no raw krausen added into the keg it seems. Big butterscotch nose with sweet apple juice box and evident diacetyl. Taste is tangy lemon, fresh apple, herbal hops, lemongrass, doughy, salty. Palate is tangy, bitter, quenching, perhaps even lactic in the back. Amazing palate overall. So much crackery malt and fresh sourdough. Easy to gulp down. Too bad the nose was off. Otherwise stellar aesthetic wise. 5/5/8/5/14=3.7

On draught. 
Pours a very light blonde, lightly hazy with a large fluffy white head and nice lacing on the glass.

The aroma is yeasty & bready in all the right ways. A touch buttery up front, but this fades as the beer opens up. Some light mineral, some light cider, and a touch of hops. 

The flavor is perfectly bitter & perfectly dry with a gorgeous saaz character. The beer is lightly husky, not buttery, not sweet, but mildly fruity with a touch of honey character. Perfectly crisp and very satisifying.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a very small sized head of finely sized white colored bubbles that were long lasting and left behind a uncarbonated transparent weak orange colored body and a good lacing. The aroma was malty and lagerish. The crisp mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish with a malt lagerish tingly aftertaste. The flavor contained notes of malt. An OK brew just nothing special.

Draught at Pivobar U Dobranskych, Prague. Strawy-bready malt and a bucketload of hops - herbal, grassy, peppery, lemony, hay, floral,... wow! Light body, though discernibly malty, clean, with a moderately strong bitterness and an aftertaste of bread and Saaz hops. Wish this could be my everyday beer.
Che birra! Fresca, ben luppolata e ricca dì malto strepitoso! Da provare ma difficile da trovare

U Slovanské lípy, Prága. Erősen opálos, közepesen sötét árnyalatú, világító arany színe, és szép nagy és kitartó, tömör fehér habja van. Illata és íze, mint a nagykönyvben: maláta és szép mennyiségű füves, kellemesen keserű cseh komló játéka, melyen felül egy kis vajasság is érződik. Lecsengése és utóíze is finoman száraz és komlós. A koncentrált íznek köszönhetően testesebbnek is érződik, mint amilyen valójában, ugyanakkor bármeddig el tudnám iszogatni, mert egy nagyon jó pilzeni, a 10-esek között pedig különösen kiváló, igazi mintadarab!
Draught (SMÖF 2011) - Golden with a white head. Bread, yeast and malt in the aroma. Malty and hoppy taste with a tasty bitterness.
SMÖF 2011. Pale golden beer, white head. SMÖF 2011. Vegetable aroma, malty and bready. Hoppt bready flavor with some spices.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2016 Sample at SMÖF 2011. It poured a pale yellow liquid with a minimal white head. Sweet and malty smell with some pale bread. Similar taste but with a pinch of flowery sweetness. Re-rated, on tap at Örebro Ölcafé. Think this is the correct beer. Bready and flowery smell with hay. Similar taste. Nice and clean. Very easy to drink with a nice malt profile. Allot better then when I tried it at SMÖF, raising score from 2,5 to 3,7.
Sample @ SMÖF 2011. Pours clear amber with a small off white head. Aroma is malty, sweet, bready and caramel. Flavor is sweet, malty, fruity and bitter. Finishes sweet malty and bitter.
Sampled at SMÖF 2011. Pours amber with no real head. Smells and tastes bready malty with a dry hoppy finish.

(Draught at U Slovanske Lipy, Prague, 30 July 2011) Golden colour with frothy, white head. Malty nose with notes of bread, grass and hay. Malty taste with bread, grass, hints of citrus and a gentle bitterness in the finish. Rather light body, with balanced sweetness. Hardly exceptional, but decent and highly drinkable.

Tap @ U Slovanské lípy, Prague. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of bready malt, fresh grass, citruss. Taste is malt, stray, green grass, light citruss. Medium body, soft carbonation, easy drinking pilsner. 300711

Draught @ Slovanske Lipy. Insanely good pilsener this one. Pours hazy golden. Kind of light and easy going in a lot of ways, but with a crisp almost sparkiling citrus like hoppiness. Thin in the way that makes it impossible not to drink.

(Draught at Gastropub Tuulensuu, Tampere, 20110719) The beer poured golden and hazy. Its head was medium sized white. Aroma had grass, grain and mildly butter. Palate was medium bodied and dry with medium carbonation. Flavours were grain, grass, herbalness, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was grassy and bitter. Nice and quite clean pils. A bit too dry.

Draught @ Gastropub Tuulensuu
Fresh aroma has butter, some grain and hints of metal. A bit sweet flavour has some butter. It is a bit sourish which is uncommon for this style but fits in fine though. Dry finish. A very good pils, beats even the 12°.
tap at slovanske lipy.   herbal, grassy, rustic.  dry.  crisp.  clean.  awesome session beer.

On tap @ U Slovanské Lípy, Prague. Pours clear golden with a big creamy head. Malty grainy aroma, some grassy hops. Taste is moderate sweet, good malty with plenty of hops for support, well made desitka. Herbal touch on the end with some nice peppery tones, great.

Quite how they pack so much flavour and pleasure into a desitka is beyond me. Crisp, refreshing and with a firm hoppy bite, the nose is all lemon and hay, drinking is biscuity with a touch of bread. A delightful beer.

Draught, at U Slovanské Lípy, Prague. Deep, clear golden color with a ine, slick head. Biscuity pale malt and grassy hop aroma. Light, crisp flavor. Great hops--not over-bearing, but perfect balance and bitterness. Wow! What flavor for a 10 degree beer! Clean, biscuit malts, amazingly crisp. I could drink a lot of this! Smooth, but slighty zippy carbonation. Peppry finish. wonderful. A beer I want on tap at my huose in the summer.

Tap @ U Slovanske Lipy, Prague. Pours clear yellow with a lasting creamy white foam and lacings. Nose is grassy, fruity, doughy and floral hoppy. Medium and smooth body. Clearly fresh grassy hoppy taste with a bit of buiscuit. Ends dry. Fresh!
On tap. Clear golden with a creamy, white head. Sweetish malt aroma with some floral accents. Light body, sweet malts, a little sulphur and a short and very dry finish. 260608
Clear golden with large white head. Sweet fruity aroma with hoppy and caramel notes. Sweet flavor with caramel malt, hoppy and fruity notes. Well carbonated. Ends bitter.

(6/26/08) Draught at Koutland in Plzen. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma has hints of yeast and some hoppiness. Sweet flavor with some maltiness and mild bitterness in the finish. Medium-bodied. Nice.
On tap @ Koutland, Plzen. Clear and golden in colour with a medium sized head. Refreshing with notes of malt, hops, grain, eggs and flowers.
Tap @ Koutland, Plzen. Pours clear pale golden with a white head. Aroma is fresh with flowers and som malt. Flavour is fresh, malty sweet with som hops and the mouthfeel is soft.

Draught at Koutland, Plzen.
Clear golden coloured, big airy white head, bready nose. Malty and fresh hoppy flowery taste with slightly bitter watery finish.

(Draught) Pours clear golden. The aroma is light to medium sweet with notes of bread and cookie-like malt alongside light floral and citric hops. The flavour is fresh and light sweet with floral and grassy hops. Bit biscuit/cookie like in the flavour as well. The mouthfeel is crisp and light to medium dry. Light to medium bodied. A very nice 10.

Tap @ Koutland, Plzen.
Pours clear golden with a big, creamy, slightly off-white head. Okay lacing. Aroma is soft, good sweet maltiness and flowery hops. Medium carbonation - okay mouthfeel. Flavour is crisp, pleasantly hopped - feeling very fresh. Good balance.
Draught at Koutland, Plzen. Gold with whiote head. Thin with heavy toffee notes, really quite watery and lacking body. Some saving citric notes in the close, but really very average.

Draught. Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is yeast, malts, some toffee and mild hops. Flavour is a lot of butterscotch, yeast, mild sweet malts and some mild hoppyness in the finish. A bit watery.
On tap at Koutland, Plzen.  Clear gold, lasting off white head.  Bit of diacetyl.  It’s a lager with a hint of butterscotch.  Some hop on finish.  Pretty standard/poor.

Draught at Koutland, Plzen.  
Clear golden colour. Very fresh, flowery aroma with citric notes. Flowery, hay-like flavour. Light mouthfeel and not very grainy, yet with smooth maltiness. No dms here, and low bitterness. Low on the diacetyl.

From tap at Koutland. Pours clear and golden yellow with a creamy an chalk white head. Aroma is mild spiced and light hoppy. Flavour is mild sweet and light hoppy. Vague butterish note. Goes into a light dry and bitter flavoured finish.

golden with a lasting white head. Malty aroma with grain and bread notes some grassy hops and a slight hint of pilsner malt sulphur. Medium sweet flavour, malty backbone and almost enough hops to satisfy me. 4% lagers aren’t made much better than this
Tap at koutland. One of my highlights of the trip. Alround rating: Floural, lychee, lager malts, really well balanced, bicuity buttery note. Super drinkable.

Draught at Koutland (3 consecutive nights!)  Clear pale golden. Rich oraney hop aroma. Light bodied with crisp grainy malt. Well balanced hay-like hoppiness and just the right amount of diacetyl. Lingering bitterness. Excellent quencher!
Draft. A golden beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma is sweet malty with light notes of hops. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of straw as well as hints of diacethyl. The body is thin.

Draught at Koutland, Plzen, Czech Republic.  Clear golden, medium white head. Grassy and floral hop aroma on a bready malt background. Light to medium bodied, medium carbonation. Nicely balanced with a long bitterness.

At the Koutland in Plzen, supplied by omhper (thanks a lot!) Poured a golden body with not much foam. A nice sweet nose, soft maltiness and some yoghurt. A light, very drinkable refreshingly hoppy taste, yoghurty chalky yeasty notes.. Some fruity maltiness too. Wasnt as brilliant as I hoped it would be... might not be my "style", but its still lovely. Its really a shame that I only tried it on a tired palate...

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2016 Clear yellow body with a soft white head.  Yeasty but clean aroma, malt is honey-drizzled crackers, water profile is salty minerals.  Its medium to full bodies, intensely malty, savory, rich, endless in the mouth.  Hops are aged floral, honeysuckle, spice.  Its prone to heavy doses of diacetyl (which for me gets a mid-to-low 3), but at its best its a paradigm-changing lager that every serious beer enthusiast should experience.

This was the last and longest stop on the Plzen mircrobrewery rampage that montelpogo put on for my cousin Tim and I.  The 10 degree was the first out of the gate here.  .3L glass on draft.  This beer seemed so bright that it was a neon golden and quite fruity.  Some passionfruit hoppy bitterness intertwined nicely with the base malts. A mellow finish makes this "so drinkable" that it was a shame to have only one.

Back from a Czech Republic pub-crawl this is part of my express ratings for the typical Světlý 11°- (Czech light Pils), Světlý 12°+ (Czech Pils), Polotmavý (Czech Amber Lagers) and Tmavý (Czech Black Lagers).  Non-typical beers will receive personalized descriptions after the express ratings.-------- />
How: Tap at Koutland, Pilsen, Czech Republic
The look: Clear golden blonde body with a medium white head
To me a typical Czech Světlý 11° and below is: Well malted body with lots of smooth cereals and a light fresh honey sweetness flavour.  Some fruity notes (more fruity notes than in the 12°+) with mostly citrus fruits and a little lemon.  The finish is somewhat herbal and citrusy with but unlike the 12°+ there is only a hint of the dry grassy bitterness usually associated with noble/Saaz hops.  Bitterness is mild and does not really play a big role in the overall flavours spectrum.  A light meringue sensation and an overall freshness impression..  Carbonation is typically very soft.  These beers are low in intensity but very refreshing and drinkable in scarily large quantities.
This one: As above but everything multiplied by 2 (despite being so very light).  Like an unsweetened lemon pie.  Super citrusy/lemony nice tartness.  THE refreshing Světlé of my Czech Republic trip.  Extraodinary.  Drinkable in extra large quantities and god knows I did.  I went back a few times to Koutland to drink more of it just to make sure that it was so good (for the science)

En fût. Pinte dégustée chez Koutland (Plzen, Rép. Tchèque). Arôme: Odeur de céréale et dagrume. Apparence: La couleur est orangé. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût dhoublon et de céréales avec une pointe dapricot. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture minérale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût fruité. (Rating #1548)

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2009 My Bottom Line:
This scintillating Světlé Výčepní sports a tireless equilibrium of grassy, spicy hops and honeyed bready malts in a crunchy and ever-so-quenching vehicle. Another smashing quaffer by Kout.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A frothy head of foam mushrooms atop the pale golden.
-Some citrusy fruitiness precedes the hops wooden bitterness.
-The body is slender (but plumper than most 10-degrees) and leads to impressive drinkability levels.
-The maltiness in this one is a tad more clearly expressed than in the 12-degree.

On tap at Koutland, Plzen.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2015 Draught, Edmunds Oast, Charleston.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly lasting.
Body is medium to dark yellow.

Aroma is moderately malty (toasted bread/grain), lightly to moderately hoppy (flowers, herbs), with a light note of honey.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, moderately bitter.

Medium body, velvety/watery texture, lively carbonation.

An absolute dream of quaffing delight.  Im elated this (and the 12) is becoming available in the US and hope it makes it to Colorado soon.  I actually liked this more than the 12 at Edmunds Oast just because this is so much more drinkable (12 is sweeter).

On draught at Koutland, Pilsen: Golden coloured, very stable creamy white head, big, resinous hoppy nose, backed by some sweet pale malt, very full bodied for a Desitka, good malty base, robust sweet-bitter flavour, lingering hoppy-sweet aftertaste. Wow: the squaring of the circle, the best Desitka I have ever tasted.......

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2007 Several pints at the inimitable Koutland. A fantastic blast of raw, resiny hops (quite different to most Czech beers) and a touch of sulfur in the aroma. The hop aroma really wouldnt be out of place in something like a bitter. Light, lean pils malt flavour with more resiny Saaz. Loads of character for a 10%, but still has that requisite lightness/wateriness that makes them so drinkable. It didnt matter how drunk I was (and boy was I drunk!) I could still drink this stuff at a rapid rate of knots. An absolute masterpiece of refreshing drinkability. Thanks to motelpogo for showing me the way.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2007 Ausdrucksstarker, deutlich karamelliger, sehr aromatischer und ansprechender Geruch. Kräftig würziger, integriert karamelliger und fein herber Antrunk. Keinen Moment an Laschheit oder Wässerigkeit zu denken. Die Hopfigkeit ist markant, passt also unglaublich gut zu den samtigen, aber auch charakterstarken Noten. Im Mittelteil wird das Prickeln etwas reduziert, ansonsten werden die Aromen beibehalten. Anhaltend sehr würzig und die Karamelligkeit zieht sich erst im Abgang etwas zurück, dafür gewinnt die Herbe an Einfluss. Geniales Bier!
Voilá, motelpogo!

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2009 First rating(Draught at Koutland, Plzen. Thanks motelpogo for the tip!) Golden (or something, kinda dark place) color, small white head. Hoppy and malty scent, quite nice. Veru hoppy taste for a Czech beer! Medium mouthfeel, medium to high bitterness.8/3/8/3/15=3.7Rerate(Draught in Plzen)On June 26, 2008Clear golden color, white head. Sweet, malty and herbal taste. Moussy mouthfeel, low bitterness. Sweet malty and yeasty scent.7/3/6/3/13=3.2RerateAs "Koutska Desitka Svetle"Draught at the Czech Beer Festival in Prague, on May 22, 3009Clear golden color, fluffy white head. Herbal sweet hoppy scent. Sweet, herbal, bitter hoppy taste. Medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness.9/4/8/3/17=4.1

Beautiful golden body, creamy white head, lacing; Lots of dry earthy hop aromas, fresh malty behind, very special Czech nose (I guess it is because you actually only notice the hop in very few Czech beers); Near perfect carbonation on balanced both hop and malty bitter, very fresh body; It finishes a little to short, bitter fresh both malt and hop are bringing this, lots of aroma the saaz hop is very apparent and a malty warm sweetness is balancing it great. Super beer!

on tap at Koutská pivnice in Domazlice. Consistent and large white head. Very hoppy nose. Quite full flavour for a 10°, not watery at all. Intensively hopy, not bitter though, malty middle-part and hoppy finish.

This was their lightest pale pils, and still pretty fantastic. The hoppyness of the 12° is here, but in smaller doses, and this is perhaps a touch more sweet. Again with the dry apricot notes, and beautiful slightly grassy bitter hops in the finish. Very nice.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2015 on tap at modry abbe in klatovy and u skodovky in pilsen. quite a deceptive desitka. pale golden with a lasting foamy head. grassy saazy aroma. unexciting for the first few sips, seems like a regular desitka with some sugar as an adjunct but overcomes this with a buttery texture, floral and grassy flavour and a resoundingly bitter finish. seems to be the preferred drink of the skoda workers who frequent u skodovky and id say theyre onto something. very good session drinking....a few years later - still good on its day but alas thats not often
